result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Phillip Schladweiler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason Phillip Schladweiler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason Phillip Schladweiler was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Jason Phillip Schladweiler was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Aaron A. Nelson DF: Jason Phillip Schladweiler appeared. Case called at 3:18. Court reviews file. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 and amended Ct 3 to DC (947.01) in 15CF431. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 and amended Ct. 3 to discorderly conduct. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CF431. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders: Sentence W/H
- Costs on both counts
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
  Apply bond on file and apply the rest of the balance to the 15CT204 case.
  Clerk to send update of monies owed to DE.
Status conference on March 30, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson   DF:  Jason Phillip Schladweiler appeared. Case called at 4:13. INcludes 15CT204(plea hearing), 15CF432 (PTC). Atty. Nelson updates the Court. ADA Nieskes agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1  in 15CT204 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. DE acknowledges prior conviction. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in 15CT 204 . On motion of the State without objection, Crt merge and dismisses Ct 2 in 14CT204. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: 
- 10 days St. Croix County Jail
   Credit for 3 days 
   DE to serve 2 consecutive weekends commencing no later than Fri. March 11 reporting Fri. at 6:00pm
   and released the early morning hours on Mon. 
   Court grants huber. 
- fine inclusive of costs $1492.00
- $85.50 for blood draw. 
  Apply bond on file.
- AODA
- 12 mo. IID
- 12 mo DL revocation
   credit for administrative suspension
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

15CF432 continues.
Status conference at 03-22-2016 04:30 pm
Plea hearing at 01-12-2016 04:30 pm

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Edward Minser,  DF ATTY:  Ann Brose for Aaron Nelson,  DF:  Jason Phillip Schladweiler appeared from jail. Includes 15CT204 & 15CF431 Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on 14CT204 only.  Waives speedy trial. ADA Minser requests $5000.00 CB, Atty Brose argues. Waive speedy prelim.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.

INCLUDES 15CF431 & 15CT204

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Joseph V., his family or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
